intro: Calliopsis diversifolia, commonly known as the diverse-leaved calliopsis, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded woodland areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
